name: Marmalade Sour
description: While the practice of serving cocktails at breakfast is mostly relegated to history books and weekend brunches, putting breakfast-table ingredients into the cocktail shaker is a practice that's only picking up steam. Drinks containing eggs or egg whites are now fairly common at craft-cocktail bars; here's one that takes another familiar morning food and uses it to very good effect.
recipeIngredient: 2 dashes orange bitters (Boudreau recommends Fee’s for this drink)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine ingredients in a cocktail shaker; shake well, without ice, to dissolve the marmalade and aerate the egg white. Fill shaker with ice and shake very hard for 10 seconds; strain into chilled cocktail glass.
